Line 40: Line 40:
Texas Tech Univeristy is the flagship Univeristy of the [[Texas Tech University System]]. It is located in [[Lubbock, Texas]], Texas, which is the second largest city in the Big 12 Conference with a population of 270,550 as of 2009.<ref>http://quickfacts.census.gov/qfd/states/48/48303.html</ref>
Texas Tech Univeristy is the flagship Univeristy of the [[Texas Tech University System]]. It is located in [[Lubbock, Texas]], Texas, which is the second largest city in the Big 12 Conference with a population of 270,550 as of 2009.<ref>http://quickfacts.census.gov/qfd/states/48/48303.html</ref>

[[File:campus.jpg]] ''Clockwise from left to right (Texas Tech Campus, Downtown Lubbock Texas, Overton Hotel near campus, Overtown Park student housing)''
+
  +   +   +   +
''Clockwise from left to right (Texas Tech Campus, Downtown Lubbock Texas, Overton Hotel near campus, Overtown Park student housing)''
The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders]] are members of the [[Big 12 Conference]] (South Division) and compete in [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] for all varsity sports. The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders football|Red Raiders football team]] has made 33 bowl appearances, which is [[List of schools by Bowl appearances|18th most]] of any university. The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders men's basketball|men's basketball team]] has made 14 appearances in the [[NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship|NCAA Division I Tournament]]. [[Bob Knight]], the winningest coach in men's [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] Div. I basketball history, served as the team's head coach from 2001 to 2008. The [[Texas Tech Lady Raiders basketball|Lady Raiders women's basketball team]] won the [[1993 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|1993]] [[NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Championship|women's national championship]]. In 1999, Texas Tech's [[Texas Tech University Goin' Band from Raiderland|Goin' Band from Raiderland]] received the [[Sudler Trophy]], which is awarded to "recognize collegiate marching bands of particular excellence".
The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders]] are members of the [[Big 12 Conference]] (South Division) and compete in [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] for all varsity sports. The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders football|Red Raiders football team]] has made 33 bowl appearances, which is [[List of schools by Bowl appearances|18th most]] of any university. The [[Texas Tech Red Raiders men's basketball|men's basketball team]] has made 14 appearances in the [[NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship|NCAA Division I Tournament]]. [[Bob Knight]], the winningest coach in men's [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] Div. I basketball history, served as the team's head coach from 2001 to 2008. The [[Texas Tech Lady Raiders basketball|Lady Raiders women's basketball team]] won the [[1993 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|1993]] [[NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Championship|women's national championship]]. In 1999, Texas Tech's [[Texas Tech University Goin' Band from Raiderland|Goin' Band from Raiderland]] received the [[Sudler Trophy]], which is awarded to "recognize collegiate marching bands of particular excellence".
